channel.title: Candy Crush
channel.description:
Anyone play it? Gimme lives.
On a serious note, has anyone noticed how it's the most popular game? This is due to the fact that the advertising is done by the players to obtain lives via facebook. If you don't know, players request 'lives' from their facebook friends and basically everyone knows about the game.
So I am going to integrate the candy crush 'model' with my rsc server. Using facebook, players will have to receive certain benefits from their facebook friends. If their friends are interested they will be more than likely to give the game a try.
Thoughts?
https://developers.facebook.com/games/

item.title: Candy Crush
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

imthenull:

who wants their friends to know they play runescape… ?

Read full topic

item.title: Candy Crush
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Not_a_bot:

How goes Claws of Guthix? We’re all waiting for an update… hope it’s out soon!

It’s a long process, especially when you work 80 hour weeks but it’s being worked on. A massive rework of rsc is… well a massive rework.

imthenull:

who wants their friends to know they play runescape… ?

I thought about this… and it’s very funny how that works. You can sit down with a stranger irl and somehow come up with the fact that you both played rs growing up. If you are playing rs, it’s embarrassing. If you played rs growing up, it’s actually quite the opposite reaction.

tigerclan:

Not only that, but facebook is fudgeing gay

I am not in favor of facebook or any website but social media is powerful, especially when it comes to advertising, which becomes beneficial for the dead rsc scene.

[quote=“Lothy, post:2, topic:527865”]It won’t work in the same way because the games are entirely different. Runescape, an MMORPG, involves a big commitment in terms of game time. Candy Crush, like most browser games, allows you to jump right into the action.

It might work to some extent, but you’re hardly going to attract the masses to a decade-old game where they have to grind for hours before it becomes fun (if it ever becomes fun for them).[/quote]

My project is a ‘jump into the action’ kind of game. To make things short it’s a combination of minecraft, farmville and rsc/rs2. It’s an experiment that will be fun, hopefully facebook can be useful.

Also looking at if my ass will get raged on by jagex if their rsc client is on facebook harhar

Read full topic

item.title: Candy Crush
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

It won’t work in the same way because the games are entirely different. Runescape, an MMORPG, involves a big commitment in terms of game time. Candy Crush, like most browser games, allows you to jump right into the action.

It might work to some extent, but you’re hardly going to attract the masses to a decade-old game where they have to grind for hours before it becomes fun (if it ever becomes fun for them).
